answers:
Mark Twain, born Samuel Langhorne Clemens, was an American writer, humorist, and lecturer.
He is best known for his novels "The Adventures of Tom Sawyer" and "Adventures of Huckleberry Finn", as well as his humorous essays, fables, and sketches.
Twain was a master of American folklore and used his knowledge of the traditions and stories of his native land to create his works.
He was also a skilled performer and traveled extensively as a lecturer, entertaining audiences with his humor and storytelling.
Twain's legacy as a writer and cultural icon continues to be celebrated in America and around the world.

William Shakespeare was an English playwright, poet, and actor who lived from 1564 to 1616.
He is widely regarded as the greatest playwright in the English language and is known for his masterful use of language, his exploration of human nature, and his historical and mythological themes.
Shakespeare's works include plays such as "Romeo and Juliet," "Hamlet," and "Macbeth," as well as sonnets and other poetic works.
Despite being written centuries after his death, Shakespeare's works continue to be performed and studied today.

Agatha Christie, born as Agatha Mary Sayers, is a celebrated English novelist, short story writer, playwright, and agnostic cryptographer.
She was born on September 15, 1890, in Torquay, Devon, England, and her father abandoned the family when she was young. She was educated at a convent school and later at the University of Oxford, where she studied French and Classics.
After her studies, she worked as a teacher, a secretary, and a librarian before turning to writing full-time in 1925. She is best known for her detective series featuring Hercule Poirot, a Belgian detective who solves crimes using his exceptional powers of observation and deduction.
Agatha Christie's works have sold over two billion copies worldwide, making her one of the best-selling authors of all time. She was also a prolific writer, publishing over 90 detective novels and short story collections, as well as plays, essays, and even a novel for children.
Agatha Christie passed away on January 17, 1976, but her legacy as a master of the detective genre and a beloved figure in English literature lives on.

Barbara Cartland was a British author who wrote more than 70 novels in a variety of genres, including romance, adventure, and mystery.
She was born in 1916 in Kingston upon Thames, London, and grew up in a middle-class family. She attended the University of London and studied history and geography.
After her marriage in 1940, she focused on her writing and published her first novel, "The White Tower," in 1949. She wrote every day until her death in 2001 at the age of 85.
Her novels were popular with readers for their romantic plots, detailed descriptions of settings, and nostalgic feel. However, some critics have argued that her work lacked depth and was formulaic.
Despite this, Barbara Cartland's legacy as a prolific writer and influential figure in the romance genre continues to this day.

Danielle Steel is a prolific American author who has written numerous bestselling novels in various genres, including romance, mystery, and women's fiction.
She was born on November 2, 1956, in Toledo, Ohio, and grew up in a small town in Michigan. Danielle attended Michigan State University, where she earned a degree in English.
After college, Danielle worked as a secretary and a waitress to support herself while she raised her two children. She began writing in her spare time, and her first novel, "Love at First Sight," was published in 1988.
Danielle has since published more than 100 books, including several bestselling novels. She is known for her romanticized portrayal of wealthy men and her tendency to use clichés and formulaic plots in her stories.
Despite criticism from some readers, Danielle continues to write and has a large following of fans who enjoy her books.

Harold Robbins, also known by his pen name Robert R.
, was an American writer, born on September 3, 1930, in Cleveland, Ohio. He was best known for his mystery and thriller novels, which often featured amateur sleuths or eccentric characters as protagonists. Robbins passed away on May 1, 2017, in Naples, Florida, at the age of 86.

Georges Simenon, born Georges Jean Simonin on March 3, 1903, was a Belgian novelist, playwright, and screenwriter.
He is best known for his Inspector Maigret series, which follows the adventures of a middle-aged detective in the French town of Maigret.
Simenon's works often explore the themes of crime, justice, and human nature.
He wrote over 200 books and plays during his lifetime, and his works have been translated into dozens of languages.
Simenon was also a screenwriter for Belgian and French films, contributing to the popularization of his works through the medium of cinema.
He died on October 4, 1989, in his native town of Mauléon-Wisthaven, Belgium.

Enid Blyton was a British children's author, born on April 19, 1917, in Macclesfield, Cheshire, England.
She is best known for her "Famous Five" series, which features a group of young friends who solve mysteries and go on adventures in exotic locations such as Mallorca, Corfu, and the Greek Islands.
Blyton's other popular series includes "The Secret Garden," "The Wind in the Willows," and "Nancy Black," among others.
Her books have been translated into over 40 languages and have sold over six billion copies worldwide.
Blyton passed away on August 21, 2016, at the age of 99 due to natural causes.

Sidney Sheldon was an American author who was born on November 11, 1917, in St.
Louis, Missouri. He was best known for his novel "The Bridges of Madison Avenue," which was published in 1955 and became a bestselling novel.
Sheldon wrote more than 60 novels in his career, many of which were bestsellers. He wrote about a variety of topics, including romance, mystery, and family drama.
Sheldon died on January 24, 2019, at the age of 101. He was survived by his wife of 74 years, Barbara, whom he married in 1941.

Akira Toriyama is a Japanese manga artist, writer, and animator who is best known for creating the popular anime series "Dragon Ball" and "Goku" franchise.

He was born on March 24, 1976, in Fukui Prefecture, Japan. He started drawing manga while in elementary school and continued to do so throughout his schooling. After graduating from high school, he attended the National Academy of Fine Arts in Tokyo, where he studied painting.

During his time at the National Academy of Fine Arts, he created the manga "Kinnikuri" which was later adapted into an anime series. This was his debut as a manga artist.

After graduating from the National Academy of Fine Arts, he worked as a staff artist for the manga magazine "Saizan no Mag" before launching his own manga series, "Urusei Saga," in 1999.

His most famous works include "Dragon Ball," "Goku," and "Kekkai Sensen" (Blood Stained Angel). He has also worked on various video game adaptations and other media projects.

In addition to his work in manga and anime, Toriyama is also known for his distinctive character designs and storytelling style. He has won numerous awards for his work, including the prestigious Tezuka Award in 2007.

Despite his success, Toriyama remains humble and dedicated to his craft, often expressing his gratitude to his fans and followers.

Leo Tolstoy, born Lev Tolstoy (1820-1910) was a Russian novelist, short story writer, and playwright.
He is best known for his novel "War and Peace," which is considered one of the greatest works of fiction in the history of literature.
Tolstoy was also a prominent social critic and his works often address issues such as religion, politics, and social justice.
Some of his other notable works include "Anna Karenina," "The Cossacks," and "The Death of Ivan Ilyich."
Tolstoy's works were often criticized for their realistic portrayal of the lives of the Russian peasantry, and he faced censorship and persecution during his lifetime for his political views and beliefs.
Despite this, Tolstoy continued to write and advocate for social justice until his death in 1910.

Alexander Pushkin (1820-1862) was a Russian poet, playwright, and novelist who is widely regarded as the founder of modern Russian literature.
Pushkin's works are known for their lyrical beauty, social critique, and exploration of human nature. He was a prominent figure in the Russian Romantic movement, which emphasized emotion, imagination, and individualism.
Pushkin's most famous works include the plays "The Seagull" and "Evensong," as well as the poems "The Twelve," "The Cherry Orchard," and "The Bronze Horseman."
Despite facing censorship and persecution during his lifetime, Pushkin's influence on Russian literature and culture continues to be felt today.

Stephen King is a well-known American author who has written numerous horror, fantasy, and science fiction novels.
He was born on September 21, 1947, in Portland, Maine, and has been a prolific writer since his debut in 1970 with the novel "The Shining."
King is known for his vivid and often terrifying descriptions of horrific events, as well as his ability to create complex and relatable characters.
He has sold over 300 million copies of his books worldwide and has been translated into more than 40 languages.
King's works have also been adapted into numerous films, television shows, and other media, including the popular "King's Novels" series of non-fiction books.
Despite his immense success, King remains an avid fan of horror and fantasy genres, and continues to write to this day.

C++ is a high-level programming language that is used to build various types of software applications.
It is an extension of the C programming language, which was the first high-level programming language to be designed. C++ was designed to provide more advanced features than C, such as object-oriented programming, dynamic memory allocation, and support for large systems.
C++ is widely used in various industries, including game development, operating systems, web development, and scientific computing. It is also the most popular programming language for developing mobile applications, with frameworks like Android and iOS using C++ for their back-end processing.
Some popular C++ libraries and frameworks include OpenGL, Qt, and Boost.
Overall, C++ is a powerful and versatile programming language that has been around for decades and continues to evolve with the changing needs of software development.

Python is a high-level, general-purpose programming language that was first released in 1989.
It was designed to be easy to learn and use, with a syntax that is similar to that of C, Java, and other popular programming languages.
Python is known for its readability, simplicity, and versatility. It has a large standard library, which means that it comes with a wide range of pre-built tools and functions that can save developers a lot of time and effort.
Python is used for a wide range of applications, including web development, data analysis, artificial intelligence, machine learning, scientific computing, and more.
Some popular Python frameworks and libraries include Django for web development, Flask for web applications, NumPy for numerical computing, and TensorFlow for machine learning.

Java is a popular, open-source, object-oriented programming language that was first introduced in the early 1990s by Sun Microsystems.

It is used for developing various types of applications such as web applications, mobile applications (Android), desktop applications, and even game applications. Java's primary goal is to provide a platform for developers to build applications and services that can run on any device, anywhere in the world.

Java is known for its:

1. Platform Independence: Java code can run on any platform that has a Java Virtual Machine (JVM). This means developers can write a single codebase for multiple platforms.

2. Object-Oriented: Java is fully object-oriented, which allows developers to use objects, inheritance, and polymorphism in their code.

3. Security: Java provides a secure environment by isolating class loading and executing code.

4. Large Community: Java has a massive, active community that contributes to its continuous evolution and provides resources like libraries, tools, and documentation.

5. Ecosystem: Java has a rich ecosystem of tools, frameworks, and libraries that can accelerate development and enhance the quality of applications.

Some popular Java frameworks include Spring, Hibernate, and Apache Struts. Java libraries, such as Java Database Connectivity (JDBC) and Java API for XML Processing (JAX-AP), provide essential functionalities for data access and processing.

JavaScript is a programming language that is widely used for creating dynamic and interactive web pages.
It is a client-side scripting language, which means it is executed in the user's web browser rather than on the server.
JavaScript can be used for a variety of purposes, such as:
- Creating interactive forms and user interfaces
- Implementing animations and special effects
- Adding dynamic functionality to web pages
- Creating custom user interfaces with tools like jQuery UI and Bootstrap
- Interacting with server-side technologies like Node.js and Express.js
- Building mobile apps with frameworks like React Native and Ionic
- Creating server-side APIs with Node.js and Express.js
- Automating repetitive tasks with tools like Jest and Puppeteer
- Creating chatbots and other AI-based applications with tools like Dialogflow and Microsoft Bot Framework
Overall, JavaScript is a versatile and powerful language that can be used for a wide range of applications and use cases.

Perl is a powerful, flexible, and efficient scripting language that is widely used for a variety of tasks, including web development, system administration, and data processing.
Perl is a Perl-compatible version of the C language, which means that it adheres to the IEEE 754 floating-point standard and the latest version of the Perl syntax.
Perl is a popular choice for web development because of its ability to handle large volumes of text and data, as well as its support for Unicode characters and its ability to work with multiple simultaneous connections.
Perl is also commonly used for system administration tasks, such as automating system configuration and maintenance tasks, and for data processing tasks, such as parsing and manipulating text data.
Overall, Perl is a versatile and powerful scripting language that can be used for a wide range of tasks, from simple scripts to complex applications.

OpenCV (Open Source Computer Vision Library) is an open-source computer vision library that includes several open-source computer vision libraries under one roof.
It is used for various purposes such as image and video processing, computer vision, and machine vision. OpenCV is widely used in various fields such as robotics, surveillance, and security systems.
It provides various functions and algorithms for image and video processing, including feature extraction, object detection, and image filtering.
OpenCV is released under the terms of the GNU General Public License (GPL), which allows users to use, distribute, and modify the software for any purpose, as long as they follow the GPL license terms.
Overall, OpenCV is a powerful and versatile tool for image and video processing, and it is widely used in various applications across different industries.
